trans-unit.source: Provides services and properties that are common to visual 3-D objects, including hit-testing, coordinate transformation, and bounding box calculations.
Unlike the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D> class, <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D> objects cannot be shared or reused.
Access <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D> services by using static methods on the <xref:System.Windows.Media.VisualTreeHelper> class.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D> objects are optimized to be scene nodes.
For example, they cache bounds.
Whenever you can, use <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D> objects for unique instances of objects within your scene.
This usage contrasts with that of <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D> objects, which are lightweight objects that are optimized to be shared and reused.
For example, use a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D>object to build a model of a car; and use ten <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.ModelVisual3D> objects to place ten cars in your scene.
Defines the parent-child relationship between two 3-D visuals.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D.AddVisual3DChild%2A> method is introduced in .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
The child 3-D visual object to add to the parent 3-D visual object.
The children collection cannot be modified when a visual children iteration is in progress.
Applies the effect of a given <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock"></xref> to a given dependency property.
The <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref> to animate.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock"></xref> that animates the property.
Applies the effect of a given <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock"></xref> to a given dependency property.
The effect of the new on any current animations is determined by the value of the handoffBehavior parameter.
The <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref> to animate.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock"></xref> that animates the property.
The object that specifies how to interact with all relevant animation sequences.
Initiates an animation sequence for the <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref> object, based on the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline"></xref>.
The animation sequence is triggered when the next frame is rendered.
The <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref> object to animate.
The timeline that has the necessary functionality to animate the property.

Initiates an animation sequence for the <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref> object, based on both the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationTimeline"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Animation.HandoffBehavior"></xref>.
The animation sequence is triggered when the next frame is rendered.
The <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref> object to animate.
The timeline that has the necessary functionality to customize the new animation.
The object that specifies how to interact with all relevant animation sequences.
Returns the common ancestor of the visual object and another specified visual object.
The visual object with which to find a common ancestor.
The common ancestor of the current visual object and otherVisual; or `null` if no common ancestor is found.
Retrieves the base value of the specified <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyProperty"></xref> object.
The object for which the base value is being requested.
The object that represents the base value of dp.
Returns the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D"></xref> in the parent <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3DCollection"></xref>.
By default, a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual> has no children.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D.GetVisual3DChild%2A> method is introduced in .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
The index of the 3-D visual object in the collection.
The child in the collection at the specified index value.
The index value is not valid.
Gets a value that indicates whether this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D"></xref> has any animated properties.
`true` if this element has animations; otherwise, `false`.
Determines whether the visual object is an ancestor of the descendant visual object.
A visual object that is a possible descendant.
`true` if the visual object is an ancestor of descendant; otherwise, `false`.
Determines whether the visual object is a descendant of the ancestor visual object.
A visual object that is a possible ancestor.
`true` if the visual object is a descendant of ancestor; otherwise, `false`.
Called when the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3DCollection"></xref> of the visual object is modified.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D"></xref> that was added to the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D"></xref> that was removed from the collection.
Called when the parent of the 3-D visual object is changed.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D.OnVisualParentChanged%2A> method is introduced in .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
A value of type <xref href="System.Windows.DependencyObject"></xref> that represents the previous parent of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D"></xref> object.
If the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D"></xref> object did not have a previous parent, the value of the parameter is `null`.
Removes the parent-child relationship between two 3-D visuals.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D.RemoveVisual3DChild%2A> method is introduced in .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
The child 3-D visual object to remove from the parent visual.
Gets or sets the transformation that is applied to the 3-D object.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D.Transform%2A> property is introduced in .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The transformation to apply to the 3-D object.
The default is the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Transform3D.Identity"></xref> transformation.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D.Transform"></xref> dependency property.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D.TransformProperty> is introduced in .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).

Returns a transform that can be used to transform coordinates from this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D"></xref> object to the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D"></xref> ancestor of the object.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D.TransformToAncestor%2A> method is introduced in .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D"></xref> to which the coordinates are transformed.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeneralTransform3D"></xref> object; or `null`, if the transform cannot be created.
ancestor is `null`.
The specified ancestor object is not an ancestor of this object.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D"></xref> objects are not related.

Returns a transform that can be used to transform coordinates from this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D"></xref> object to the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> ancestor of the object.
This transform projects a 3-D point to a 2-D space.
The resulting point is the transformed 3-D point in the coordinate space of the specified ancestor.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D.TransformToAncestor%2A> method is introduced in .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Visual"></xref> to which the coordinates are transformed.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeneralTransform3DTo2D"></xref> object; or `null`, if the transform cannot be created.
ancestor is `null`.
The specified ancestor object is not an ancestor of this object.

Returns a transform that can be used to transform coordinates from this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D"></xref> object to the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D"></xref> descent object.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D.TransformToDescendant%2A> method is introduced in .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D"></xref> to which the coordinates are transformed.
A object; or `null`, if the transform from descendant to this object is non-invertible.
descendant is `null`.
This object is not an ancestor of the specified descendant object.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D"></xref> objects are not related.
Gets the number of child elements for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D"></xref> object.
By default, a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D> has no child elements.
Therefore, the default implementation always returns 0.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D.Visual3DChildrenCount%2A> property is introduced in .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
The number of child elements.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D"></xref> object to render.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Visual3D.Visual3DModel%2A> property is introduced in .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Model3D"></xref> object to render.
